item.title: Gender Ratio, Asset Allocation, and Elderly Retirement Arrangement
item.description:
• Using CFPS database to explore relationship between elderly retirement arrangement and gender ratio of their children.
  • Using national census data to construct Iv for gender ratio variable.
  • Preliminary analysis suggests that with higher gender ratio of their children, people of retirement age tend to continue to work instead of retire. Also, families with higher gender ratio have significantly higher house loan than those with lower gender ratio of children.
